message_1:
Consider a closed orientable surface M of genus g with a Riemannian metric g. Let L be an oriented, embedded loop in M. Show that the space of L-gradient trajectories (i.e., pseudoholomorphic map from R×S¹ to (M,g) asymptotic to L at infinity) is a manifold of dimension 2g − 1.

Numerical Problem: Let M be a torus with a flat metric and let L be the embedded loop on M corresponding to the boundary of a square, with each side having length 1. Find the space of L-gradient trajectories (i.e., pseudoholomorphic map from R×S¹ to (M,g) asymptotic to L at infinity) in this case.

Step 1: Define the space of L-gradient trajectories
